comments.raw_text:
A) Steps to reproduce:
1. Choose a big file to download
2. Download window opens

B) Steps to reproduce:
1. Ctrl + J brings the download window

Noticeable bug:
* Unless you hover over the "clear" button and the "search" field you won't see them drawn

Noticeable drawn order:
* If you pay attention closely you can see 1) the window (outer area) being drawn, then 2) the button and search field at the bottom and then 3) the files that have been downloaded. The problem is when number 3 happens it actually makes the clear button and the search field to dissapear

comments.text:
Created attachment 515353
[screenshot] Firefox failed to draw download window properly

A) Steps to reproduce:
1. Choose a big file to download
2. Download window opens

B) Steps to reproduce:
1. Ctrl + J brings the download window

Noticeable bug:
* Unless you hover over the "clear" button and the "search" field you won't see them drawn

Noticeable drawn order:
* If you pay attention closely you can see 1) the window (outer area) being drawn, then 2) the button and search field at the bottom and then 3) the files that have been downloaded. The problem is when number 3 happens it actually makes the clear button and the search field to dissapear

comments.author: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> I am still hitting it with:
> Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b13pre)
> Gecko/20110302 Firefox/4.0b13pre
> 
> Could it be related that I have D2D disabled and my machine uses Direct3D 9?
> 
> Asa were you able to reproduce the problem previously?
> 
> bjacob do you know why DirectX 9 gets used on my machine if Directx 11 shows as
> installed?

We can only use either D3D 9 or 10. Many intel cards seem to have trouble with D3D 10 initialization; when they fail, we fall back to D3D 9.
comments.creator: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com

> Asa were you able to reproduce the problem previously?
> 
> bjacob do you know why DirectX 9 gets used on my machine if Directx 11 shows as
> installed?

We can only use either D3D 9 or 10. Many intel cards seem to have trouble with D3D 10 initialization; when they fail, we fall back to D3D 9.
